bibl.title: Telegram from Philip Showalter Hench to Albert S. Truby, July 20, 1943

div1.p: Hench congratulates Truby on the publication of his book.

div1.head: Telegram from Philip Showalter Hench to Albert S. Truby, July 20, 1943
div1.opener:
WESTERN
UNION
1201
A. N. WILLIAMS
PRESIDENT
NEWCOMB CARLTON
CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD
J. C. WILLEVER
FIRST VICE-PRESIDENT
__________________________________________________
The Editing shown in to the
B4 NIGHT LETTER VOUCHER 7198
JULY 20 1943 COLORADO SPRINGS COLO
145 LAUREL ST SAN FRANCISCO CAL
GENERAL ALBERT E TRUBY
div1.p:
SIMPLY DELIGHTED WITH YOUR BOOK WHICH ARRIVED TODAY
FORMAT EXCELLENT-PHOTOS ACTUALLY BETTER THAN ORIGINALS
YOUR YEARS OF PATIENT LABOR HAVE CULMINATED IN SPLENDID BOOK
OF WHICH YOU YOUR FAMILY AND FRIENDS CAN BE JUSTIFICABLY
VERY PROUD IT SIMPLY HAD TO BE PUBLISHED AND NOW ITS DONE
VERY GRATEFUL FOR PRESENTATION COPY

FOR GENEROUS INSCRIPTION AND PUBLISHED COMMENTS BUT MOST OF
ALL FOR YOUR FRIENDSHIP WHICH I PRIZE MOST HIGHLY
div1.closer: PHILIP S HENCH THE COMPANY WILL APPRECIATE SUGGESTIONS FROM ITS PATRONS CONCERNING ITS SERVICE
